intro: Aeschynanthus candidus, commonly known as the white-flowered ivy. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. It produces showy, bell-shaped blooms that are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aeschynanthus candidus is popular as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering display.
